parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To watch, observe scrupulously. From para and tereo; to inspect alongside, i.e. Note insidiously or scrupulously.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
A spy. From en and a derivative of kathiemi; subinduced, i.e. Surreptitiously suborned as a lier-in-wait.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To act the part, pretend; I answer, respond. Middle voice from hupo and krino; to decide under a false part, i.e. dissemble.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.
From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From archomai; a commencement, or chief.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hegeomai; a leader, i.e. Chief person of a province.
